website_summaries.verdict: Portable propane grill good for all outdoor entertaining. Has 20,000 BTU of heat across large grilling surface.
pros: Can swap interchangeable tops from cooktop to griddle to stovetop if you purchase separately
cons: Needs option to adjust flame length for better cooking
May  be too heavy to be considered portable

customer_reviews.title: Works every time like a  charm !!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't trade this grill for the world!! This grill is reliable & rugged and cooks better than any grill I have ever owned and I take it everywhere I go!! This grill it easy to clean and the whole thing is just top notch!!
customer_reviews.author: April Portwood

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY BUY!! Use it outside on balcony at apartment, and to the beach. Food tastes delicious grill flavor and it's easy to clean and put away. Not for large amounts of cooking at once but a must have anyway. People ALWAYS ask about it and want one for themselves. Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: ELLE

customer_reviews.title: Love it to the Moon!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this grill! I bought it to take on camping trips in the RV, but I like it so much it hasn't left my patio! I may get a smaller grill for the RV ... haven't decided yet. This one is bigger than you'd think. It is just heavy enough to be stable in the wind, and I like that.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor J. Barton

customer_reviews.title: For the price,,, can't beat it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these units before. Just a heads up for new buyer's put a washer on the back side of the wheels and just a touch of grease. If not the plastic to metal contact will cut into the wheels making it very loose. Other then that it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great grill, portability a big plus!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good...connected a 20# tank with the 5 foot hose adapter purchased separately. Went together relatively easy, wheels and handle, that quick! Double checked venturi tubes (placement) by taking the top off...6 screws, pretty easy. First meal, some burgers, sausages and corn on the cob, Only thing I would say is there is a learning curve relative to the heating and moving things around, otherwise it was great! I did line the inside around the burners with aluminum foil to aid in keeping it clean. Cleaned the grates with a rolled up ball of foil, a wet rag and then a dry one...figure every 3 times or so I'll clean the grates in the sink.
customer_reviews.author: MBRY

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS GRILL!!!
customer_reviews.text: OH MY GOD, get this grill!! Stop reading reviews - just go buy it. I spent SO much time reading reviews here and I'm glad I did, but let me save you the time and just say GET THIS GRILL. Small, portable, and it packs some SERIOUS heat! I am a vegetarian, so I can't speak to its meat grilling abiliites, but I can cook up a huge plate of grilled vegetables in about 5 minutes, and I do pretty much every night. Clean up is easy, the lighting is fast, the switching the tanks is fast and easy.....Honestly there are no cons. BUY THIS GRILL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. S

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this grill a few times, and it has not held up well. The flame coming out of the burners is not even, resulting in hot spots and burned food. Due to the configuration of the grill grate, I do not get an even char or much grill flavor. I chose this grill because of the dual burners, so I could do indirect cooking. Due to the small size, I do not see enough of a temperature difference to allow for this method, resulting in overcooked food. It is too late to return, so it's going into the trash. I wish I had stuck with Weber. I've used the WeberQ in the past with great results.
customer_reviews.author: AmyMcc

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best grill that I have ever owned. Not only is it great for camping, but it is great for everyday use and apartment living, as it is easy to fold up and put away. What I like the most other than it being so compact, is it's so easy to clean. I've used it for barbecues and it wipes clean with little effort. Also, the lowest price I have found for this item has been Amazon, truly a great item.
customer_reviews.author: SBuck427

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Coleman
customer_reviews.text: I am going to boycott Coleman over this grill. This is my third road trip grill. When I receive this one the regulator would not put out any heat. I have the burner attachment and it would not boil water nor fry anything. I contacted Coleman and they have given me the runaround for 2 months. They would not except the electronic receipt from Amazon which shows order number, payment method and delivery date. They were only trying to make the 90 day warranty run out. This has been one huge hassle with them. Never again. Beware don’t buy Coleman. You will never get your warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Easy Cleaning Grill
customer_reviews.text: I've had the grill now for over a month and grilled three times, cleaned it twice. The grill is fantastic! I bought an accessory that allows connecting to the larger BBQ propane tank. My previous grill had lousy temp control and it either under cooked or burnt the chicken but that's not the case here. This grill top no matter how charred it gets, it's cleanable ( see before & after photos). This grill is portable, clean able and has a solid design build, plus it grills like a champ! You can't go wrong buying this Coleman Portable Grill !
customer_reviews.author: Dennis LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Flip and Move
customer_reviews.text: The heat distribution on this grill is HORRIBLE. I bought it to keep on the job site so my guys can cook up a hot lunch when they want to. Plus: Inexpensive. Heats up quickly. Very portable. Fine if you want to reheat cans of Dinty Moore stew. Negative: Ridiculously bad heat distribution. You can't get the burners low enough to decently cook a hot dot, hamburger, etc or toast a bun. Everything burns on one side and is unheated on the other. If you want this grill to work efficiently, you need to flip and move everything every 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Jbh Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: It cooks marginally well. There are some design issues ...
customer_reviews.text: It cooks marginally well. There are some design issues. The cover latch is a small diameter steel rod, which does not securely stay in the closed position. The cover popped open the first time I tried moving it using the handle/wheels. The heavy cooking grates, which are also not secured, came flying out, hitting the cover and chipping the cover paint. I took the latch apart and increased the lever tension and bent the wire latch to make contact with the hood. Even after doing that, I use a bungee cord across the hood to keep it from opening when moving it. Some other minor issues makes this a pass.
customer_reviews.author: The Reluctant Buyer

customer_reviews.title: WARRANTY - You're kidding right?
customer_reviews.text: Seems nice BUT there is a warranty IF you register your product on line - GOOD LUCK with that. After about 20 minutes on hold I got a person who said she would send me an email - they want pictures of the grill and a copy of the receipt. I'm sure the computer wizards could do this but being 76, I don't have a clue. So when it fails and or needs parts I guess I'll just throw it away and buy a new one. So much for CUSTOMER SERVICE.
customer_reviews.author: August Trometer

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my tiny balcony. I like it very much, but my BF does not. He has banned this from any future camping/tailgating trips. I have had a very difficult time collapsing it for transport, ended up with a huge bruise on my shin. Once folded, it rolls easily but is VERY heavy for me to lift up into a car trunk or pickup truck. I would recommend this for anyone who needs a compact and sturdy grill and can handle the weight if transporting. I have used 4 gas canisters (1lb size) and have cooked over 2 dozen meals in over three months. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: M.B.

customer_reviews.title: Just a terrible terrible design
customer_reviews.text: terrible design would never purchase again stay away from this product Coleman should have never release This I Swear everytime I see a commercial for this or I see it at a store it angers me so bad these damn Things Fall Apart as soon as you try to move them soon as you grab the handle it just collapses and then you get grease everywhere or whatever you're cooking falls off is a terrible design I swear if I could I'd go back in time and return this product or go ahead and not even purchase it stay away from this product going through and getting a different product
customer_reviews.author: Rocky A. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: ... when I first received this grill I was in love! It’s now been eight months since we bought ...
customer_reviews.text: So when I first received this grill I was in love! It’s now been eight months since we bought it and it doesn’t work! It barely put out a flame at all. The flame is so small I’d probably be able to touch the grill with my bare hands. What really bums me out about it is I ordered one for my father-in-law because I thought it was such a great bye! Looks like I’ll have to buy him a new one in about eight months just like I have to buy myself a new one. What a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Maile King

customer_reviews.title: Um, I like the color?
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool. Compact. Cheap (I mean, inexpensive). However, the burners are WAY too close to the grills - a problem they solved by making the center of the grills solid. Makes for an erratic BBQ experience. Once you get used to finding or avoiding the hot spots, you;re back to cool, compact, and cheap, so I still like it. If you want a BBQ that takes up less room than then 4,000 shirts each child brings on a 3-day camping trip, this could be just the thing. Not loving the griddle option (separate product). No grease trough in the griddle so it makes a mess and can cause flare ups.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Flannery

customer_reviews.title: Insane Price for a Great Grill.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grill. My first weekend with the grill I cooked very thick steaks, corn on the cob, chicken thighs, and burgers. I also cooked bacon using the accessory grate. Everything came out fantastic!! Most of the time I used low heat with the cover up. For the thick steaks I seared them first and used low heat with the lid down some of the time. I have a Weber Genesis at home and let's face it, they are not the same but for the price I paid for this and the results I got I'm a big fan!! I highly recommend. The last portable Coleman grill I had lasted 20 yrs with plenty abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Regan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for two busy people with limited outdoor space. “Assembly” was elementary. The grill is easy to maneuver and a quality product. Well constructed, sturdy and durable. Grilling is every bit as good as on a full-size stationary grill with enough room on each side for 2-3 hamburgers or one steak with veggies. Cleaning is a breeze. The propane canisters don’t last long, but they are readily available at home improvement stores (cheaper thru Amazon), or a full-size tank can be connected. We bought another grill as a condo-warming gift and it has been a big hit.
customer_reviews.author: SClinton

customer_reviews.title: Great for campers and tailgaters than don't want to deal with charcol
customer_reviews.text: We camp 30+ nights a year and this was a great investment! Though it's not nearly as clean as we hoped (all those drippings will rot and stink up your RV if you leave it inside uncleaned and it's a solid 10 minute job getting it real clean for storage) it keeps the smells out of our trailer and cooks pretty well. It's not super even as the areas directly above the burners are much hotter than the edges but it's not terrible and we are overall very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grill!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little grill. We took it camping after purchasing it on amazon and it did not disappoint. We cooked burgers and even threw some bacon on and they cooked to perfection. It’s easy to set up and take down as well as transport. There were no issues whatsoever- would definitely recommend to anyone. ** we purchased the extension tube in case we wanted to use the larger propane tank. Turns out we did t need it.. the small one gallon propane canister was enough for four days cookibg 1-2 meals a day.
customer_reviews.author: By His Grace

customer_reviews.title: One of the best things about it is that it is easy to ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this a year and half ago. One of the best things about it is that it is easy to keep clean (why do I always wind up on the clean-up committee???). It is light but solid, the grates are a sturdy cast iron which heat up evenly and quickly. It also transports well and I'm grateful that it combes with a cover. All in all a very good purchase for our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy in Sagamihara

customer_reviews.title: Not a good grill
customer_reviews.text: It is extremely difficult to control the rate of cooking on this grill. I have tried low heat, indirect heat and using a griddle top. Every method results in burnt. The burners are directly below the cooking surface which results in high heat applied to the food regardless of how you try to cook. On the plus side it's a clever travel design but alas useless for actual cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: So far this gets 5 stars...
customer_reviews.text: We like everything about it so far... although the wheels need to be redesigned because you cant really pull it anywhere if you are over 5' 2. If you are average height, when you walk it scrapes the floor, rendering the wheels basically useless. You will be better off using some kind of dolly to wheel this around. Other than that, this thing is great in that it cooks perfectly, as well as big gas grills should cook. So far one small gas cannister has lasted us all winter, although we only cooked outside 4 times because it is freaking cold out!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Hot
customer_reviews.text: I love this BBQ. Powerful and Hot. You can hook it to your Coleman propane tree or use the bottles. Easy to wipe clean when cool. Cools pretty even considering it a portable BBQ. Handy slide out side shelves. Easy to fold down and put back up. Great to stuff in the cargo hold of a camper, in the back of your truck or even in your cars trunk. The available Stainless Grill insert and Griddle are a must. Takes it up a notch anyhow for pancakes, eggs, and whatever you might want to boil in a big pot.
customer_reviews.author: SALMONSLAYER

customer_reviews.title: We really like the grill
customer_reviews.text: We really like the grill. It is self supporting so no carrying a portable table to set it on or having to put it on a picnic table. I did change the connection to be able to plug directly into the low pressure quick connect on our RV. Love having the ability to do this. It is a bit difficult to clean and the flame is susceptible to being blown out by wind but overall we like it. You will need to learn how to position things on it to cook.
customer_reviews.author: NBB

customer_reviews.title: Have to re learn how to use it and come up with same results as other prev equip.
customer_reviews.text: All good except it is hard to get what you are cooking brown without burning it. Wish one side did not have the flame protector in the middle when I want to sear meat. But it would also be nice to (not) have flame at all on one side, especially since usually cook meat on one side and something else like veggies on the other. But have learned to do better with practice.
customer_reviews.author: For Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: You must use this grill with a 1 pound propane cannister or a 20 pound tan and a Coleman hose .... not any other hose will work. Any other propane tank may void the warranty. Also, I find this grill difficult to move. And now the spark starter no longer works. The RoadTrip grill is not designed to withstand the rain. The drip tray fills with water since all the rain on the lid flows into the grill. So plan on also buying a Coleman cover. Coleman customer service is a droid who reads the computer text in front of him/her. This is not the Coleman quality I grew up with camping in the '60s.
customer_reviews.author: Runnyknose

customer_reviews.title: What a great little bbq for camping
customer_reviews.text: What a great little bbq for camping. You can set it up quickly, and it cooks your steak like a dream. Nice size for whatever you bbq but not to big to tuck away for traveling. Easy to clean, great flame with lots of adjustment. It's even big enough to use at home since my back yard bbq died, this one replaced it in a flash since I'm a single guy I don't need anything bigger. Very happy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: P. WaltonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Keep it out of the rain...
customer_reviews.text: What a nice little grill! Flame control is a little tricky, but cooks very well. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because: All of the chrome will rust! I had planned on packing it up and putting it in the garage when I wasn't using it, but left it out on my back porch (under cover) last weekend. Little rain came through that night. I just noticed last night that all of the chrome has rust spots on it. I guess the best thing to prevent this would be to get a cover for it or go ahead at put it in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dr. Hardcrab Poe

customer_reviews.title: Cheap moving parts. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Wheels were wobbly from the time we put them together. On one wheel, the pin inside wallowed out the hole almost immediately. This BBQ never even left the house, we just moved it from the front porch to the back porch. It's nice to be able to switch out the skillet/grill tops, and lifts up pretty smoothly, but this thing never felt sturdy and is useless without wheels. We did not get anywhere contacting Coleman. It's been sitting in the garage after one summer and will probably be sold on Craigslist.
customer_reviews.author: EO

customer_reviews.title: When it works it's great. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. Frustrating. When it works it's great. Unfortunately, I'm pretty sure I have a faulty regulator. Here's the timeline: - Ordered last summer. Worked great for about a month. - Then it wouldn't light. - Emailed manufacturer, who sent instructions on how to re-set the regulator. - That worked. About twice. Then it stopped and I had to re-set it each time. It was hit or miss, mostly miss. - Now I just tried to fire it up for the first time in the spring. Nothing. Tried re-setting the regulator. Nothing. And of course I'm sure it's passed the warranty stage. So, Coleman, Amazon, anyone... how do I order a new regulator?
customer_reviews.author: Rob312

customer_reviews.title: Great Option for Camping and / or Condo Grilling
customer_reviews.text: Needed a super small grill for the condo and occaisional camping. This thing works great... So far cooked steaks, ribs, pork loin, burgers, hotdogs, baked potatoes, and more. A few things to keep in mind: Its small so temp control can be difficult... you need to watch your meat. Also, no need to turn all the way up. Cooking area is small and burners are MORE than enough for normal cooking. Is it as good as a regular stand alone grill? Nope, but its not trying to be. It is amazing as a small / travel grill!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jiwilliams79

customer_reviews.title: Convenient grill
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a grill for a small space. Fairly easy to assemble. I have not tried to transport it. 2 issues: The drip pan is hard to access if the gas bottle is attached. Since I keep mine outside, rain fills the drip pan regularly with greasy water that then drips onto patio. Disposing of gas bottles. The camping gas bottles are (relatively) cheap, convenient but not refillable and not easily disposed of in a ecologically responsible way. Better to buy a refillable bottle and the connecting hoses if you want to use the grill a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Live for Books

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: So far it's been outstanding. We purchased a few accessories (griddle, swaptop stove grate, extended fuel hose, etc.) and it is a perfect companion to your RV. Lets us do virtually all of our cooking outdoors. Folds up quickly, roll it away, easy to store in a small space. Cleaning it is easy as well. Durability may be the only issue.....have to wait and see.
customer_reviews.author: Lobo Azul

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the RV
customer_reviews.text: This was my RV solution to having a real grill. The only thing I cannot do with it that I can on my full size is smoke meats. Great temperature control, even heat distribution and plenty of thermal energy makes this a great little stove. My only complaint is it is a bit small for multiple dishes when grilling for a 6 or 8 people (perfect for 2 or 4) I would love one that had another 100-120 sq.in. of grill and an expandable top cover so I could use it as an oven or a smoker. I would gladly give up the wing tables for these features in the same stored size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Good grilling quality; can't be adapted to our preferred propane supply
customer_reviews.text: When considering grilling ease and quality, the grill is quite good. We'd like to be able to find the fitting we can use so that we can connect the grill to the propane supply for our diesel motorhome rather than use the very small, non-refillable propane bottles. In order to use the motorhome propane supply (which has it's own regulator) we need to take the regulator off the grill and install a metric fitting to the grill. We haven't been able to locate the metric fitting. Since this is a grill used by many rv'ers, one would think that Coleman would engineer the propane supply capability we're looking for into the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskaheaven

customer_reviews.title: High recommendation for a portable that gets red hot!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grill because it puts out a tremendous amount of heat and is well made. Sure, some metal can be thicker but it would end up in a different price bracket. For a portable grill, I would rank it up in the very top. I get 3 pretty good size BBQ's out of a single propane canister including several minutes of getting the grill as hot as possible. To further emphasize the heat/BTU's, I just grilled out in the desert on a bit of a mildly windy day and the brats got a bit burnt with the lid closed. If you're thinking about it, do it. I am extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, the good reviews do not reflect my experience with this grill. To be honest, I wish it wasn't to late to return it. Nothing, and I mean nothing cooks on it right, EVERYTHING will burn before the inside cooks, no matter the temp you use. The piece of garbage is going for sale on CL, maybe I can re-coop some of my money. Unless you want food that is burnt on the outside, before it even cooks on the inside, it's best to stay away from this grill! So disappoint Coleman!
customer_reviews.author: John Mi'bo

customer_reviews.title: Great at first!
customer_reviews.text: Was the best thing ever at first. Was so excited to purchase this and bring it camping but after the first summer is was pretty tired and the paint was peeling off from heat. It doesn't clean up easily either. After 5 years it's just a sad lawn ornament ☹️.
customer_reviews.author: Ehimmelman

customer_reviews.title: Possible the best portable grill I've ever messed with
customer_reviews.text: Possible the best portable grill I've ever messed with. The cast iron grates get super hot and add so much flavor to your food. They are designed to evenly distribute the heat which they do a phenomenal job at. I love that there are interchangeable tops for the grill if your needs are other than just grilling. Portability is amazing. Be sure to give regular cleaning and wipe downs for a longer grill life. Overall, 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Mickey White

customer_reviews.title: Just ok!  I wouldn't purchase again!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as hopefully a great grill for roadtrippin. Its nice but kind of a pain. It only uses the little canisters sold at various stores meaning the connections are very specific. There is no place to put those special wire connections and if you forget them you can't use the grill nobody sells replacement connectors. It works but I've had 3 people cut themselves when assembling it during various uses. Just not that happy with design and restrictions. I would not purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: Online Shoppers

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and cooks well, but the left burner ...
customer_reviews.text: The left burner does not ignite via the igniter. I'm having to use a manual lighter for that. I can't find anything in the manual as to how to fix this issue. Also, very difficult to clean after cooking food that has grease, such as hamburgers. The grease gets all over in the bottom and there's no way to take out the bottom tray and clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Belisle

customer_reviews.title: Prefect size and great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smaller grill to go on my porch since I live in a condo. I also love to camp and hike and picnic and anything else you can do outdoors. So when I came across this grill, I was thrilled. I think the only thing that would have been easier about assembly, would be if there was none. Seriously, it was that easy. Great quality. Durable material. Easy cleanup. I cannot tell you how happy I am with this grill. And everyone I've shown it to has loved it and wants one. And did I mention it's portable?!
customer_reviews.author: writergrl

customer_reviews.title: Great travel grill
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill, it’s the second one like it our large family has purchased. My only complaint is that sometimes the propane tank is difficult to get on and the connection has to be just tight to get gas.. that’s always a struggle, then it’s smooth sailing. The fact that it folds so easily is why we opted to get a second one, it’s just so easy to wheel it where you want it and pop it up. Many of our friends have converted it to use a big tank and had less set up problems.
customer_reviews.author: danielle mullen

customer_reviews.title: Good But Could be Better
customer_reviews.text: This grill works very well and cooks food very quickly. You really need to lower the flame and closely monitor the progress. The portability for a grill this size is easy and convenient. The only negative I have at this point are the grill plates. The 2 piece set is cast iron and NOT porcelain enameled as one of the descriptions states. They are very heavy and not easy to clean. If these plates were porcelain covered this grill would be a 5 in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Micksop

customer_reviews.title: Love the grill, but drip tray/propane holder location seems like an afterthought. Pain to maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: Love the grill, but the drip tray location relative to the propane tank holder wasnt well thought out - you cannot remove the tray without work because the propane tank holder is in the way. Have to force/bed the tank holder to get the drip tray in and out no matter which way the tank holder is turned and tried raising it on its pivot. Dissapointing for such a handy grill that this nuisance makes it a pain to maintain. Also its a little awkward to raise for 1 person - it kind of gets away from you trying to get the feet into the holding rails under the grill. 2 people much easier time raising/lowering.
customer_reviews.author: IT Guy

customer_reviews.title: 10/10, Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE our little grill! We got this when living in an apartment where we weren't allowed to keep things other than patio furniture & plants outside. This folds up nicely & we were able to keep it folded up & tucked away when we weren't using it. We've definitely gotten our money's worth out of it. It's easy to use & set up, & since it's so small, cleaning up afterwards is very easy. My parents are so impressed with it that they're thinking of getting one to take camping with them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen B.

customer_reviews.title: Great portable grill
customer_reviews.text: Just used this grill on Friday for an office party to grill hot dogs and hamburgers. This is a cool little grill. Keep in mind this is a portable grill so it will not have the same power as a traditional propane grill, but this is reliable and gets the job done. Also, I should note that the design is very attractive - it looks pretty sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: OK - But
customer_reviews.text: Light and easily portable as advertised. Trade-off for the light weight is thin/cheap easily damaged construction however. Handled with care it does the job -- but don't drop it (case dents , grates shatter, etc). Also significant rusting apparent after 1.5 years (stored outside under roof). Likely you'd be lucky to get a 3 year life out of the grill without significant loving care and protection from the elements. Update at 2.5 Year: Badly corroded after several years of outdoor storage (under cover). Ready fo disposal. Likely a good buy for occasional tail gating with protected indoor storage and TLC -- but poor choice for significant home patio use.
customer_reviews.author: hr

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Grill
customer_reviews.text: This unit is heavy, but very strong. I followed all the instructions and set it up in an hour. It's beautiful, sleek, and functional. I first used it last Saturday to charbroil some oysters. I had trouble getting the burners lit, we had wind speeds up to 20mph. So I recommend a backup lighter. I used it again this afternoon. It lit perfectly on the first try. I recommend this grill for anyone who wants a travel grill or a small, easy to handle grill.
customer_reviews.author: Marlea

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Grill
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill! We take it tailgating at football and baseball games. It works wonderfully and heats evenly over the grills. It folds up easily and is not difficult to lift in and out of the car. The only downside is the grates do not stay in place if the grill is stored upright in the folded position. Would have liked to have had clamps for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: KarenW

customer_reviews.title: One Burn Works, One Doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews I though was going to be a great grill to take camping. But after using it one season, suddenly the right burner no longer burns above the very lowest flame possible. The left burner stills burn great. I took it apart but could find nothing wrong with it. I would not recommend this grill based on my experience. Two stars because the left one still works and it IS quite portable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great grill...great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Grill on Amazon Prime day and was very pleased with this item. We recently went camping and used this grill to cook most of our meals and it performed very well. It was easy to assemble and to set up at our campsite. It is very mobile and not too bulky or heavy. I cooked chicken and steak on the this grill and was very pleased on how well it performed. I used the small propane canisters for this trip but also purchased the hose to attach a 20 gal tank. This was a great purchase for the price...very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Marzfoto

customer_reviews.title: Good grill for the price but be careful
customer_reviews.text: It’s the most affordable and easy to use portable grill available. I have used it for camping and also at my backyard for few years now. There is a newer version of this out there. Heat distribution is not good. One need to be careful while cooking as one side of the grill will be ok and the other side would be burning. Not hard to clean but I line it with aluminum foil.
customer_reviews.author: MKEM6

customer_reviews.title: Awesome performance but not simplest to collapse
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on several camping trips. Setting it up and using it is flawless. We have taken the grill off and put pots directly on the burner and we have done steaks on the grill. Everything cooks up very quickly and perfectly. It's proven to be very easy to clean, too, with how glossy the inside of the grilling compartment is.
customer_reviews.author: surrealfrog

customer_reviews.title: Too hot, difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Good if you like your food burnt on the outisde and raw on the inside while spewing smoke. Tried to like this but after 3 years I had to get rid of it. Okay for hot dogs or patties but any actual cooking or grilling is a nightmare- the dials are useless and as other have said, turning it down seems to do nothing and the flame catches most of my food on fire no matter what. Underneat the grates is difficult to clean since a lot of the drippings get caught around the burners which cannot be removed.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Good grill
customer_reviews.text: Grill is great. Only reason for the 3 stars is the box it came in was totally demolished, including the packing. Still amazed that they wasn’t any dents or scratches. This was for a raffle we were having but I did put it in the raffle with the box destroyed like it was. I know I wouldn’t want to buy a ticket for something that was in that shape regardless of if it’s working or not.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy L.

customer_reviews.title: Good grill.
customer_reviews.text: First weekend camping with this little grill. It went really well, especially if you get the other grill tops for it (griddle and stove). I also go the bag, very convenient, just needs a few extra pockets for utensils. For its purpose, this grill is excellent. A few drawbacks: -Not great heat control. -Small drip tray (empty it each time!) -This is not designed for particularly rough terrain. It wants a level surface (and fair enough btw). Overall, very good value. It will run on small green propane cylinders or you can get the adapter and hook it up to a bigger 20lb bottle.
customer_reviews.author: L. Quirk

customer_reviews.title: Fair at best, it does work but... (read on)
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and about 25 or more rivets fell out of the grill. Very clumsy to stand up, easy to hurt yourself so be careful when standing up or collapsing. Cleaning the grills is like any other grill, but the chrome under the grill does not come out. It is riveted in so you really can't clean under that. The gas canisters are the small ones, (10lb) use and throw away, no way of refilling it, doesn't seem very "Green". The canister is kind of funky the way it hangs off the back. Was trying to find and adapter to use a regular 20lb propane tank, but have not found it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice smaller profile grill.
customer_reviews.text: Chose this model as I didn't want to buy a normal sized single burner grill with the large propane tank. Can easily roll this one into my garage when not in use. Grills quick. If you're a well done person like me, you have to keep an eye on the meat, turning it frequently to avoid charring. I had the same challenge with my Coleman portable grill. Seems like Coleman likes the burners close to the grates. Not a problem if you're medium to medium-well person, but takes some close attention to get a good well done steak. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: gak48

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap but it's awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, it's awesome. The perfect thing for our trailer road trips and it matches our vintage orange sunburst accents of our '63 Airstream. Feels cheap and that's because it is. I don't like Chinese stuff either but this is a great grill. It's also surprisingly easy to manage the heat for the perfect steak - low lows and high highs, just like my relationship with my ex-girlfriend.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Just what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: We needed to replace our old barbecue grill that had seen 15+ years of use and weather. The Coleman Road Trip was a good price, and the compact size takes up a lot less space on our patio, with the added benefit of being able to collapse and move it out of the way when it's not in use, plus the interchangeable cooktops make it much more robust for what foods can be cooked on it. We also spent the extra $20 to buy the Coleman 5 Ft. High-Pressure Propane Hose and Adapter so we could use a regular 5-gallon tank instead of the small Coleman ones.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Wheel Fell Off
customer_reviews.text: This is a good grill for travel except the first time we used it one of the wheels broke off and it cannot be fixed. So, we prop up the broken side in order to make the grill level, but this requires us to take an extra piece of wood along with us. Further, now it is not portable since you. A not roll it around, Since we did not use this grill until after the one month grace period we cannot even return it. Wish I would have bought it at Costco when they had it, you can return items there for a full year.
customer_reviews.author: Cgh3

customer_reviews.title: Works great - easy to move/transport
customer_reviews.text: Works great! We wanted something to use at home to take up less space, easy to move, and to take camping. Very happy overall. Disappointed with damages during shipping. The paint was severly chipped and the lock portion was broken completely off. Too much hassle to exchange so we kept it and it functions as expected!

customer_reviews.title: I hat it!

Took the gas extension hose off many times and reattached it. Prepare meat to grill but have to do it on the inside stove because grill won't light. Tried matches but still no flame. Return period has expired and I CANNOT, repeat CANNOT, contact anyone by phone. Am a very good customer of Amazon but I guess that doesn't count for anything. Always thought Coleman was a good product but forget that too.

customer_reviews.title: what is it going to be like after a week of camping in the Mountains with ...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 uses there is rust pitting on the cooking surface. I just spoke to your 800 number and was told it is caused by environment, that is rediculous !! This is for camping and other outdoor use! The name Coleman had been a standard for top notch outdoor gear, and this certainly is not up to standard! One of this reasons I bought this one was because of the name. This was after 2 uses, what is it going to be like after a week of camping in the Mountains with that enviroment? That's was one if the dumest replays I have ever heard!!

customer_reviews.title: This is a great grill

Very easy to set up from the collapsed position. Just put you foot on the front handle and pull the grill towards you with its built in handle. Comes right up, then set it into the locked position and off you go. You can easily move this around while it is open. Just remember to pull the side trays out while cooking so you don't melt them underneath. Having gone through many other grills with disappointment this one fills the ticket perfectly. I Love this Grill
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the grill but not so much with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the grill but not so much with the fact that it arrived with a broken handle/latch. We opened the box and before we even started to remove it from the box, the broken piece fell out. We had to finish unpacking it to see where it came from. Since it is to bulky and heavy for us to repackage and return for replacement, we will just try to order the part from Coleman. Hoping this review is helpful. We have no complaints at this time with the grill since we haven't used it yet. Just unhappy with the condition when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: what are you people talking about this little baby works as good as my big grill
customer_reviews.text: well i bought this after reading reviews alot negative, what are you people talking about this little baby works as good as my big grill, just dont put the lid down if you are cooking on high ,but why would you be cooking on high unless you're burning your food. perfect for ND tailgating.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat this grill for camping!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Coleman RoadTrip LXE Portable Grill. Excellent design, well built, many great features, very easy to transport. With a low pressure RV adapter and a 12 foot quick disconnect hose you have an instant cooking surface outside of you trailer! What could be better. An excellent grill for tailgating.
customer_reviews.author: ENE

customer_reviews.title: Regulator never works for propane output
customer_reviews.text: This is our third road trip to purchase and they regulator never works so we purchased one from a different source and love it. It did not come in the color we ordered sorry for the mixed review you either love it or hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Almost Live Fan

customer_reviews.title: Overall great grill!
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a few weeks now and it's been great very well made love the inter-changeable grilling plates and the stainless steel makes cleaning a snap just wipe with wet soapy sponge/cloth and dry and the grills clean up fairy easy too so far. There are some heat spots which seems normal for ring burning grills in my experience. Very portable but would highly suggest to remove the grills before moving the unit.
customer_reviews.author: hotdog71

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product from Coleman
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product from Coleman. I understand there can be a lemon here and there, every manufacturer has these problems, so the bad reviews here and there. Let me say that we bought this for a camping trip in the mountains and it worked right out of the box. No issues...PERIOD! Lit every time first try, cooked burgers, steaks, hot dogs, and boiled water like I was on the home stove. 5-stars all the way!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Lid Design Flaw Caused Damage
customer_reviews.text: This grill was easy to put together and seemed to have high quality parts. But a crucial design flaw caused damage: The lid of the grill has a latch that does not securely keep lid closed when transporting. This caused the lid to fly open, chipping the lid's paint. Others have pointed this flaw out and I totally agree.
customer_reviews.author: Captain ET

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grill!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grill. Took the grill with us on our recent camping trip, and used it 3 times so far this summer. But one important note... Like another reviewer posted, make sure to always cook on low setting no matter what you cook on it (or you could burn your weener)! Make sure to get a few extra cannisters of propane, the small ones do not last too long. Just one tiny gripe, the grill is fairly heavy but its actually a good thing so it wont fall over to easily. Still giving it 5 stars though.
customer_reviews.author: dcm

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It takes seconds to set up
customer_reviews.text: I had this grill for about 4 years now. I love it! It takes seconds to set up. And it fits perfectly in my Nisan Sentra. Do not let the size of this grill under estimate the cooking power. This thing can dish out food and dish it out fast! 1 small tank is enough to feed people of 4 for a day. After 4 years. And just basic TLC. This grill has not rust, no problems. Works just like if I got it out of box. Just basic cleaning after use and you will spend years of grilling.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: A very handy grill. We use it every trip ...
customer_reviews.text: A very handy grill. We use it every trip in our motor home. Seems to get dirtier than most other grills but it's not hard to clean. Knocked off 1 star because the propane bottles do not line up correctly with the bracket that holds them. I'm not going to use the expensive small bottles after I run out so it won't matter. I bought a hose so I can use a regular propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Love this Grill!
customer_reviews.text: Easily fits enough food for a family of four. Impressed my barbq brother with how quickly it was able to cook 4 costo rib-eyes. Delicious! Easy to use, and easy to clean. Heats up quickly. Heavy gauge grills. Easy to fold and store when winter comes. So happy with this purchase. It was just what I wanted in a compact grill..
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Grill works great! Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Grill works great! Good quality, but has hotspots (like other reviews) and my closing latch mechanism was broken right out of the box. Other than that, grill itself works fine and as long as you keep your eye on the food it is plenty hot and cooks great. Does NOT come with a cover or transport bag, so I recommend getting one if you plan to travel with it. Very useful in keeping grease out of your car trunk. A little on the heavy side, but for tailgating and camping, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This grill is amazing. A huge step up from the little charcoal ...
customer_reviews.text: This grill is amazing. A huge step up from the little charcoal barbecue I used to use. My favorite thing is the accessories available for it, mainly the griddle. I like making breakfast while camping, and I recall a time when I was trying to make bacon for twenty people in a single pan. With this grill and the griddle I can turn out breakfast for 20 or more in less than an hour. Although the handle on my grill was broken when it arrived, I love this thing so much that I decided to fix it with a bit of monkey glue rather than return it. This grill is that good.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Cushing

customer_reviews.title: Best semi-portable grill!
customer_reviews.text: Best portable grill ever! I used to be a Weber fangirl. I owned their portable gas and charcoal grills and also their Weber Q200 series. Then after a few years of moving around and selling grills, I knew I didn't want to spend $300+ on a semi-portable grill anymore. After some research, I discovered the Coleman Road Trip Grill LXE and have been in love ever since. The wide surface area and efficient design allows me to cook a lot of food fast! Unfortunately, I moved to another apartment without an outdoor space and had to sell my grill but if I get a patio again, I'm buying this grill again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Successful Thanskgiving Camping trip
customer_reviews.text: The Roadtrip LXE completely exceeded my expectations. We went camping for Thanksgiving week and I wasn't sure if this would hold up to our cooking. It did that and more. I brought a 20 lb propane tank and had no issues. Side tables were not bad. A little small but that's expected. From cooking breakfast, heating up the percolator, to cooking ham and turkey, all was done effortlessly.

customer_reviews.title: Great durable grill worthy of the Coleman name. Highly recommend this grill!

I love mine and I'm buying another one for my son as a present. Definitely recommend this grill!

customer_reviews.title: Great portable grill!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to be a portable grill. We've used it a few times after seeing one in action and lamented our old worn out camp stove that was like using a lit match or two. This one heats up fast, and cooks it all. The handy pull side shelves are nice to hold a few items, too. This sets up fast like an ironing board. My only suggestion is that you do use a hose connector and a bigger tank. You can use the small tanks without an adapter, but will burn through those quickly and they are not refillable. Buy this one!

customer_reviews.title: Lasted Two Winters.

Sure, I could wait for it to cool, then fold it up and store it inside, but who's got time for that? product_meta.title: Coleman Propane Grill | RoadTrip LXE Portable Gas Grill
product_meta.description:
Show off your grilling skills on camping trips and picnics and at tailgating parties with the Coleman RoadTrip LXE Portable Propane Grill. This outdoor grill combines a collapsible design with convenient features that facilitate grilling in tough conditions. The grill's individually adjustable dual burners each blast out 10,000 BTUs of heat, giving you enough cooking power to prepare a wide range of foods, from grilled veggies to thick slabs of steak. The Swaptop interchangeable design allows you to switch out the grill grates for a griddle top or stove grate (both sold separately), while the Instastart ignition lets you light the burners simply by pushing a button. Ideal for summer cookouts, this portable gas grill also excels in chilly conditions thanks to PerfectFlow technology, which helps ensure steady heat output. Sliding tables on both sides of the grill provide easy access to ingredients and utensils and can be tucked away for easy transport and storage. With its 285-square-inch cooktop, this grill offers a large cooking surface area without sacrificing portability. Its collapsible stand sets up in seconds and folds up for compact storage, while its large handle and wheels make the grill easy to transport. And thanks to its porcelain-coated cast iron grates and removable grease tray, this camp grill is easy to clean.

AMAZON.COM
Take the convenience, efficiency, and versatility of the household barbecue grill on the road this summer with the clever Roadtrip Grill LXE from Coleman. Whereas other portable liquid propane grills are petite and tabletop in design, the Roadtrip LXE is a full-size grill with collapsible scissor legs for countertops or travel. This 36-inch grill features 285 square inches of cooking space, ideal for toting to the beach or just into the driveway a small block party. Two 10,000 BTU burners cook meats evenly. Independent control knobs allow users to adjust temperatures on either burner for flexibility. 

 The grill comes equipped with two warp-resistant cast-iron grill grates, coated in porcelain for cleaning convenience. Two side tables attach to the grill's sides for extra preparation space and store neatly under the grill. A grease tray catches drippings, sliding out for cleaning. The grill is outfitted with an Instastart electronic ignition. The grill affixes to a standard 16.4-ounce disposable propane cylinder, or can be hooked up to a 20-pound tank with an additional accessory purchase. Burning on high with a propane cylinder, the grill operates for 2.1 hours, while low settings allow operation for up to 4.5 hours. A heavy-duty vitreous lid cased in painted steel contains flames to reduce hazard while barring access to bugs and debris. The collapsible legs feature two wheels on one end and a wide handle on the other for towing. To clean the cooking surface, use mild detergents and avoid steel wool. Coleman offers several interchangeable Roadtrip cooking surfaces, including a stovetop and griddle, for separate purchase. This grill requires assembly. Coleman offers a limited five-year warranty for this item. Collapsed, the grill measures 36 by 22 by 13 inches with a shipping weight of 60 pounds. Propane is not included. --Jessica Reuling
